website_summaries.verdict: A handy solar charger for keeping aircraft, marine, and car batteries ready to use, even when stored for long periods.
pros: Alligator clamps attach to car batteries
In full sun, outputs full wattage advertised
cons: Won’t keep car batteries fully charged
Any shadow on the solar panel will drop its output precipitously

customer_reviews.title: Is it Working???
customer_reviews.text: All car components test A+. Solar charger fuse, connections all good. But, amber LED never turns green after hours in South Florida sunshine using either alligator clips or ring harness.If I go North for a few months as usual, will I return to a dead battery? Who knows? I don't want to find out at 3AM some night when I arrive the charger failed to charge and I'm stuck waiting for ride or for AAA to show up. Buy a product that works as described. UPDATE: contacted Deltran service by email per instructions 5 days ago: no response. Like the unit, are they working?
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Russo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the camper! Add disconnect switch
customer_reviews.text: I added this to the propane cover of our camper to help maintain a charge in our battery. If you don't leave it plugged in, it drains the battery and doesn't stay charged for long. This should do the trick! 6.7.17- well, it isn't working. The brain of it isn't functioning correctly so now I will have to get a hold of the manufacturer to get a replacement. When I will I will follow up again. 3-12-2019 update I added a battery disconnect switch so my camper when parked can no longer drain the battery when parked. I have the battery tender hooked directly to the battery and it now seems to be keeping the battery charged. Supper happy
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Thank you, thank you for this battery tender!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in Sept. 2017, so I've used it now around 4 months. I have a 1999 Ford Taurus and the battery is 2 years old. I guess I might drive my car once or twice a month, so I had to drag out the charger, charge the battery, so I could use the car, every time! Since, I hooked the Battery Tender up to the battery, my car starts, every time. It has started, even when the temperature has been in the single digits and teens, for 2 whole weeks. I am thankful and thrilled, that I purchased this product. It was really easy to hook up, too.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Not a total solution
customer_reviews.text: Used on 2 vehicles. Although it helps extend the time before the battery is drained, it's not a set-and-forget solution. I've still got to run the vehicles periodically or the battery will get depleted.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rusco

customer_reviews.title: Built in China, Beware or wiring.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work, not even a millivolt. Buy guess what? The high quality control in China is amazing, it was wired backwards. Black wire to pos and red to neg. I reversed the wires between the box and the controller and bingo 12v output. I would venture to say that most of the units that get bad reviews were build by wong guy. Maybe wong girl, have to be PC these days.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing! Protect SUV's battery!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to protect 4Runner battery while I keep it parked in the yard. (I ride my motorcycles daily & will switch back to the 4Runner if/when I need to) This helps to keep my new battery charged for the occasional Home Depot trip. (had to get a new battery after the old one died from no use) Also got the battery 25' extension which is helpful should I need to adjust where I put the solar panel. I love this thing! No more dead batteries, no need for a nearby outlet or electricity just the everyday sun of Southern California!
customer_reviews.author: K.Lani Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Failing units?
customer_reviews.text: I realized this unit has not been working since I bought it, I had it connected to one of my vehicles to maintain the battery but it fails to charge. I did a test to see if there was any measurable current coming from the unit but got no readings. I did notice the L.E.D. on the control module would light up while in the sunlight but no current from the wire. I have started to fine a high percentage of post from people saying these units are failing in very little time. Battery Tender may need to consider a little quality control before placing their name on a product...
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived "DOA"...twice!
customer_reviews.text: I've used products for this company before with very good success, so I was surprised to get one of these that was not out-putting anything. Thinking that was just an anomaly, I asked for and received an identical replacement and the new one wasn't working either!
customer_reviews.author: Rob H.

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money, VERY dissapointed!  :(
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this solar charger/maintainer for a 12 v deep cell battery for my horse trailer back in June. I took it out of the box new this past weekend as I haven't needed to use it until now. Set it out in the sun for several hours, the indicator light was on, hooked up the lines to the battery, indicator light turned green like it was supposed to. An hour later I checked on it, indicator light was not only off, it is still off and not operating after 4 days in full sun! Perhaps I got a "lemon" but I'll not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Dye

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Airplanes
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my Cessna 120. It's parked outside and I don't have access to power. I have it tied up on the back of the fuselage and remove it before flight. Aviation batteries like to stay topped off and this does a great job. Even on cloudy days it manages to get some juice in the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Tamer A

customer_reviews.title: Really sucks! I have read quite a few reviews on ...
customer_reviews.text: Mine was also DOA! Really sucks! I have read quite a few reviews on here about this. I have always thought that Deltran (Batter Tender) was a good company that made quality products. I guess I was wrong. I am sending this back for a replacement one. Hope that one works. Or I will have to go with a different brand. Where has the Quality and Pride of your products gone. BUY A DIFFERENT BRAND. With this many DOA I hope Deltran does something about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Been using for several years now and it is great. I have yet to have either of my ...
customer_reviews.text: Been using for several years now and it is great. I have yet to have either of my boat batteries die or get low on voltage. Sometimes I go several weeks or months between using the boat and the batteries are always fully charged. So the trickle charge seems to really be working. Unsure of how this would work in the winter as we get alot of snow and darkness that I switch over to an extension cord/charger for winter months since the boat isn't used for 4-5 months.
customer_reviews.author: T. Klotzbach

customer_reviews.title: Great for the boat!
customer_reviews.text: This is just a wonderful solar panel that I leave on the boat (18" Hewescraft) to keep the batteries charged up during the winter when it's not being used. It acts like a trickle charger so it won't over charge and keeps the batteries full at all times. Has a long enough cord to reach outside the boat from under the cover to get the light. And, it's waterproof. Living in Washington, we don't get much sun at all in the winter but this solar panel still works great, keeping the system charged up! LOVE IT! One of my better purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Maintains good battery voltage
customer_reviews.text: My 17 Chevy truck would have a flat battery after 3 weeks of not using. This charger is able to maintain battery voltage in cloudy weather and charges to full voltage in full sunny weather. Cost a little more than some other options, but worth the extra cost IMHO. I mount inside on dash and plug in to lighter socket, you may need to change a fuse position on newer vehicles to have voltage path with ign off. 60 day edit: Keeps my truck battery top off (12.2V) as long as 5 weeks with out starting.
customer_reviews.author: Claggett's Bengals

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT RECEIVE THE PANEL
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually order such items but my husband wanted this for our boat. I was embarrassed when I gave him this gift on Christmas morning and he asked me where the rest of this item was. We re-visited my order history and verified that I ordered the correct item, which I did. The panel did come with this item. It came with the charger only. We requested a refund and I am afraid to order another one, in fear it will come the same way again. I wish I could be assured that the item would come with both pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but won't hold up to normal use. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this solar charger to use on my tent trailer to keep the battery topped off. I mounted this panel on a piece of plywood and just set it on top of my tent trailer to try it out while just sitting in my driveway. I kept it cleaned off and looking good. I checked to see if the battery was keeping charge a month later and found that some where along the way it stopped working. The battery was down to 8 volts. I am very disappointed that it did not do as advertised. Looks good but won't hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Linda K. Hodgson

customer_reviews.title: 2 defective units
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. Has voltage coming from the panel itself, but no output through the controller. Requested a replacement. It has the same problem. I should have trusted the negative reviews vs the trusted name brand. Ended up buying a different brand for 1/3 the cost and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: I have owned this charger for less than a year ...
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this charger for less than a year. I have infrequently used it and I suspected it was not working. Tested it with a multi-meter in direct sunlight and it has no output. Not sure when it died, but it did have over 12 volts output as I tested it immediately after it was purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind
customer_reviews.text: This worked out great. I have my pontoon in dry storage, so I trailer it to the lake. While in storage I attach the Battery Tender to my battery boxwith a battery charger male adapter. Battery stays charged and I'm good to go anytime. Peace of mind from Battery Tender.
customer_reviews.author: D. Welter

customer_reviews.title: Still happy after 11 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these to keep the small 12v battery on my house's backup generator topped up. The generator does not charge the battery while running, so I had to plug in a charger once a month to maintain it. Got sick of the hassle and bought this solar charger. I added a ring terminal plug to the battery, which mated to the included cable. It's been 11 months, and so far the charger is doing what I bought it to do. Don't know how it will hold up over time, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Network Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Ok, this is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a while ago to use on a second vehicle that would be sitting. Didn't end up using it, just brought the battery inside. Fast forward to now, and I found a good use for it I thought. I can put this on the travel trailer when it's not being used. Well after 5 days I went out to check the trailer, and the battery is actually down to 60% with nothing else on. The charger actually discharged the battery. Useless...
customer_reviews.author: David J. Woodard

customer_reviews.title: I use this on my 2002 GM pickup truck that ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my 2002 GM pickup truck that I rarely use. I was having problems with the battery going dead in between uses. ( I must have a battery drain somewhere.). After attaching this, even this winter when we would have many days in a row of snow and clouds, the truck starts right up. I decided not to put it back on a few weeks ago, and sure enough, the battery went dead within a week. The tender is back on, now. I've moved the truck to a different location where it doesn't get quite as direct sunlight, but so far, it is working well. I'm contemplating getting one for my car for next winter
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never worked right out of the box. Amber lite ...
customer_reviews.text: Never worked right out of the box. Amber lite constantly on "charging" however the green "charged" light never came on. I live in South Florida and the sun ALWAYS shines.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend buying the optional bolt on battery connecter rather than ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these solar battery chargers to replace an electric Battery Tender on my Mercedes e320 Wagon in Maui. This car sits for 3 months between visits and the car bleeds energy because of all the electronic equipment. I'm hoping these solar chargers will keep the battery charged as well as the old fashioned plug-in version. Our condo board decided plugging cars in was a liability issue so we had to come up with an alternative. I would recommend buying the optional bolt on battery connecter rather than use the clip on connector supplied with the solar panels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great solar charger.
customer_reviews.text: Solved the problem of getting a battery tender on my Road King that is parked quite a distance from the nearest electrical outlet. Panel was very simple to aim and put up(4 X 4 post and some angle iron from the local hardware store was all I needed) and I was in business with a controlled charger for my bike battery. Have been using it since mid winter and it charges with no problem even on cloudy winter days. Great battery tender and very easy to install/use. Going to get some more for other equipment.
customer_reviews.author: plotthunter

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Frame around panel becomes Brittle
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for almost 2 years on the roof of my car trailer until the plastic frame became bridle and let go around the screw holes going down the highway. You would think the plastic frame would be uv resistance for a solar panel? I would only buy this product again if I didn’t plan to mount it to something that moves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shocking! (Only slightly, not really.) Works very well!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I paid more than the Chinese versions cost but I knew the brand and could be assured it had a voltage regulator. Just last week I took my mower out of moth balls and the battery was at full charge, thanks to this neat little rig.
customer_reviews.author: Menocar

customer_reviews.title: Has ample power for security system
customer_reviews.text: This solar charger has enough power to keep up with the parasitic draw of a security system in a later model automobile that is inactive for a long length of time. I just plug it into an active 12volt outlet with the panel on the dashboard and the battery is still fully charged after sitting for an extended length of time. I highly recommend this solar charger!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Thomson

customer_reviews.title: Works like a Charm!
customer_reviews.text: Have this plugged into a T@B while in storage in the driveway. Keeps the battery fully charged even with light winter sun. A little hard to tell the difference between charging (yellow) and charged (green) in full sun but what are you going to do with leds. Have this connected to the ZAMP port on my trailer with an adapter (to reverse the poles) and it works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: DrRFT

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have an retired bus that I use for tailgating at NFL games. The bus is only used during football season and only for home games. Other than that it sits idle and the battery would drain from non-use. The Solar powered battery maintainer is everything I imagined it would be. It is excellent and I would recommend it to anyone who has a vehicle that gets intermittent use.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Schina

customer_reviews.title: Please note this is 5 watts, NOT AMPS
customer_reviews.text: This thing charges at approx 1/4 amp on a bright sunny day. It is fairly useless for 95% of applications. I store my diesel pickup in a shop without electricity, and my batteries go dead if I don't drive it for 4+ weeks. I figured this would keep the batteries charged while I'm not using the pickup. I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Bocephus

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great
customer_reviews.text: So my first use of this pannel I had a dead battery on my dirt bike I hooked it up and left it in the years 4 hours later started right up also used on ATV however I've yet to get it to work with the cigarette plug so beware you will probably have to wire in a pigtail tender to your battery if you wanna use this for short or long term storage for your car alarm to maintain your battery level
customer_reviews.author: Larane

customer_reviews.title: Only complaint---better instructions needed!
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on my house generator shed, to keep the battery charged on the generator. Seems to be a rugged unit. My only complaint is with the instructions. They have seven languages printed on a folded 8 1/2 x 11 sheet of paper. You literally need a magnifying glass to read it. That alone made me downgrade this rating by 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Doy Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. I just bought a second charger like this ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. I just bought a second charger like this one. I used the first on top of a hangar to keep an aircraft battery charged. I don't fly as often as I would like, and I always worried about a dead battery. I have used this for the last two years, and it has worked flawlessly. So well, in fact, that I will put the new one on the hangar, and use the old one to keep the Bobcat charged.
customer_reviews.author: L W Gawlik

customer_reviews.title: Failed after two months.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this about a year and a half ago. the charging/regulator unit on the bottom failed after two months. I removed it and the panel still worked so I rigged a controller to it and still using it to this day. But if you can not do what I did this thing is useless. I can not believe with Battery Tender reputation this product would come out of this company.
customer_reviews.author: Denkopf

customer_reviews.title: Know what size works best for your size battery.
customer_reviews.text: The product appers to be working as expected. It arrived in good order. I do wish that the company made it known as to which size panel would be best for which size battery it was intended to charge. The 5watt i purchased is really too week to charge my battery in my Dodge Ram, and if the sun is not out for a few days in a row, it has trouble keeping the battery with a full charge. That being said, the battery has NOT gone dead in my parked truck that i only start once a week now.
customer_reviews.author: srp.

customer_reviews.title: Says its charging, but idle truck battery died
customer_reviews.text: Saw some reviews warning of this, but hoped I would not be one of the ones. Truck is parked, battery was full, and charger got full sun and was in attached for 3 weeks to maintain. Went to turn on today and truck (with 4 month old battery) was dead. Not even a hint of charge. No lights or anything came on, keyless would not unlock doors.
customer_reviews.author: mpinch

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again. props to seller never been so impressed with the care a seller has taken
customer_reviews.text: For what it's worth, package was delivered much better than I expected. Product seemed quality. But in the end, I've attempted to use this on 3 seperate occasions and have been disappointed. Problem is I didn't open it right away when it was dropped off due to vacation, work, and family get togethers and now I don't feel like I should ask for a return because I've owned it for too long. All in all, great concept, just useless to charge a car battery which is ironic since it came with a pair of gator clips.
customer_reviews.author: Bpriddy

customer_reviews.title: not very good
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the solar charger for a 6x6 ATV which has absolutely no continuous battery drain . The indicator light shows it is charging but it has yet to turn green [ fully charged ] I will leave it on for another week or so but will probably have to run an extension cord under my garage door and use a conventional electric Battery Tender . I have always had good luck with them and use them on all my cars and motorcycles . The solar charger might work in the sunny South or South West but not very good in southern Ohio
customer_reviews.author: Albert I.

customer_reviews.title: Gmcould have been a 5 star but then you went and did that.
customer_reviews.text: Great product with some things..... does what it says. Best option in its class. With thus said do t love the fable length or restrictiveness of it. Charging extra for cables to make the product work is tacky.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. Bastian

customer_reviews.title: Its good, but its really for smaller batteries like jetskis
customer_reviews.text: Its good, but its really for smaller batteries like jetskis, scooters, motorcycles and such. No matter how much sun Arizona gave me, couldnt bring my chassis RV battery (group 12) up to full power. Fills the scooter and polaris with no problem. Get the bigger size if you want to charge a vehicle battery.
customer_reviews.author: Liverpooligan

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought to keep truck battery up over winter in barn with no electricity. Put in a south-facing window. The only battery drain is a security system and it does not do the job. Disappointed considering the cost and brand name.
customer_reviews.author: B1

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for two 12v batteries for my boat, as my boat is stored in a place with no electricity. I hooked them up with (2) 25 ft extension cords and 5 days later...both batteries are fully charged! Very happy! Easy to use, simple lights to let you know if charging or charged...dummy proof really. People say these don't charge, but one of my batteries was low enough that my boat wouldn't start...and this got it back to fully charged, no problem. Highly recommend it for those who can't plug in to electricity and get lots of sun :)
customer_reviews.author: William Colton Culberson

customer_reviews.title: Great addition for the RV
customer_reviews.text: I use this to keep my RV cabin batteries charged. I bought the extension cables so I can put the panel behind the windshield and connect to the batteries in the cabin. Batteries are always fully charged when I get there. In the winter, I also use it to keep the vehicle battery charged. Works fantastic, even in cold weather. Would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Travis J. Berkley

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, durable.
customer_reviews.text: Simple solution to keep my plane’s battery charged when I’m not out flying during the winter bad weeks and months. Even on cloudy days it’s still charging. Sturdy construction. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Did not seem to work for an 08 Ford Focus
customer_reviews.text: I have an 08 Ford Focus that sits outside and is unused generally. I picked this up and the solar charger to keep the battery charged. However, even during the sun-filled days in Colorado Springs, it still did not provide enough or any charge to the battery. I don't know which part failed or if it was a combination of the two. YMMV
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mellon

customer_reviews.title: easy installation
customer_reviews.text: One of the most easiest systems to install. You just hook it up directly to the battery as directed and it works as advertised. I purchased the unit for the RV to trickle charge the batteries. While connected, I check the batteries every so often to make sure its charging the batteries, for the last 3 months. Well so far so good. Great product to recommend for similar situations.
customer_reviews.author: watcher270

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Battery Tender because I love the 110 volt version of the product; however, the solar panel would never charge my motorcycle battery. Should have returned it but kept on waiting for the light to turn green from yellow.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Not putting it any power, the charge light comes on but no power output. I bought this over cheaper ones because I've had this brand plug in tenders for years, now I have to see if I can return it. My picture is mid day Florida sun. I have had it hooked to my camper battery and checked it today it's dead.
customer_reviews.author: Harley Mark

customer_reviews.title: Product did not work.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't need the product for six weeks. When it was installed and tested, I found it was not working as intended and Amazon now says it's too late for a return. I have apparently have no recourse except to keep this unusable piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: check battery
customer_reviews.text: Have your battery checked.If it is older than 3 years it is sulfated and draining faster than any solar panel can maintain So you give a negative review without checking the system .I have 3 different panels on 3 batteries one battery would not maintain .when i put a Analyzer on it the battery came up bad
customer_reviews.author: TonyL

customer_reviews.title: I made a bracket that quickly attaches to the side ...
customer_reviews.text: I made a bracket that quickly attaches to the side of my RV and the Battery Tender does the rest. Keeps the batteries up when the RV is not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Dave A

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work so far
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this despite some of the reviews since it does have a 5 year warranty and I have had good luck with other deltran products, I fabricated an adapter so i could use it on my motorcycle that has a CTEK charging pigtail. So far it seems to be working well. I'll post updates later.
customer_reviews.author: Dale E. Clapper

customer_reviews.title: It's junk.  Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Crap. Got 2 of them. Second was dead out of the box. First worked a few months. When I checked my RV the battery was dead. No voltage coming out of panel. Do not buy from this company. Too late to send this one back so I am stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R. Young

customer_reviews.title: worked for only3 minutes...
customer_reviews.text: After 3 minutes of the Arizona winter sun it no longer produces any energy.... Contrary to the advertising write-up, it is not for all weather conditions. No more output voltage at all, despite the blinking charging indicator light. I wonder how many people bought this item....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 87 year old father for his pontoon boat and smaller fishing boat batteries. It must have been easy to set up and use, because he uses it all of the time and really likes it.
customer_reviews.author: CptKat

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Glad I got the 15W model.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for recharging the camper battery even though it's in partial shade due to trees . No more lugging the camper battery home from the storage lot for charging then lugging it back to the storage lot and reinstalling. Used bungee cords to keep it attached to the trailer frame and only takes a day for charging using the 15W model.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my Battery Charged Well
customer_reviews.text: I have had this thing connected to my battery for just over a year now and it still works flawlessly. This item is great value since it has a built-in battery tender. I have it connected to my deep cycle battery on my camper and I always show up to a full charge after leaving it for weeks at a time In storage.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan A. Dix

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to keep our pontoon battery topped off after a disappointing evening when the battery was dead. It is easy to install and is working just as specified. And now I feel like we are in the sustainable energy world (a little). The only thing holding it back from being a five star review is that I think they could have included the Battery Tender 081-0069-6 Ring Terminal Harness for a complete solution rather than making us buy it separately. I guess if I had read closely enough I would have noticed it came with only the clips. But still... why not throw the terminal harness in and just increase the price $5?
customer_reviews.author: AbelBurglechner

customer_reviews.title: best looking solar panel by far, hope it continue working!
customer_reviews.text: this is a really nice unit, well packaged, looks fancy.. im actually worried that it might get stolen! .... that's my only complaint. easy to use, 2 LEDs, charging and charged. its very simple to use. i like it, seems like it's built really well
customer_reviews.author: ZaT

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work, kaputt after only six months
customer_reviews.text: I hooked this up to a vehicle that was not being used over a summer with a new battery and came back to a dead battery and a charger that doesn't work. It constantly blinks yellow no matter what it is hooked up to and in full sun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warning!  DOA
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these and they were both Dead On Arrival. I did some troubleshooting and the solar panels work OK, but the controllers do not. Check the 1 star reviews and you'll see that this is a common occurrence with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb A. Brown Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good enough to warrant a second.
customer_reviews.text: So good I bought a second one for another installation. The only shortfall is the way in which it is designed to be used (hung). Not easy for an outside application (better if with a stand, etc.. I am worried about the indicator being attached to the screen hoping it does not encourage theft (a complete unit) as the solar is outside the garage, while the vehicle is interior. All other Battery Tender products have the regulator as a separate box, and it would be better if separated in this case (like many competitors do).
customer_reviews.author: patrick hill

customer_reviews.title: Great product,  this is the third one I’ve owned.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product I’ve owned two of these panels before. I have never had a problem with these panels the last two when I sold my Jetske’s and let them go with the Jetske’s. I like the fact that it won’t overcharge the battery it has built-in safety features.
customer_reviews.author: Check out infowars

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: put it in a truck i dont use often, keeps battery from draining, i leave it on the dash. make sure you orient it towards the sun
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Miranda

customer_reviews.title: DOA!
customer_reviews.text: Says it charging but doesn’t charge, getting 24volts at the screw connections on the back of the panel but nothing from the mail charging leads. DOA!
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: The edges of the panel started to delaminates after only ...
customer_reviews.text: The edges of the panel started to delaminates after only 6 months of use. It was screwed down and still working so I did not request a refund. Now after 10 months of use, the panel is not working and coming apart. I would skip this panel and find a more durable unit.
customer_reviews.author: tom rostron jr

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works. I use it on my ranger that does not get out much. When I first put it on, the battery was dying regardless, but I found out the battery was simply past saving. With a new battery its working solid. I used a direct attach to the battery with a modular cable extension. This allowed charging without trying to run the cord in through a window or something. For this I used the standard attach cable, but cut off the ends and installed my own lugs to match the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Franco

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The battery terminal clips were easy to install on my tractor's battery and connect to the solar panel. The tractor has seen little use this Winter, but when needed there has been no problems with the battery nor starting. The standard connecting cables/wires could be a little longer. The biggest challenge was in how to mount the solar panel. I made a bill board style "A" Frame stand out of some scrap wood and hardware which seems to work.
customer_reviews.author: Jay B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for boat storage
customer_reviews.text: I have this on our boat to maintain battery while it is being stored. It has been working awesome. Battery is always at full charge each time we take the boat out. I lengthened the cord and replaced the clamps with ring connectors to make it easier for removal when boat it place in water. I would recommend this to boat and RV owners.
customer_reviews.author: Larry M.

customer_reviews.title: No connections includef! None!!
customer_reviews.text: Took it to vacation home to keep two cars charged. Opened it and no way to plug this into a cigarette lighter since the connections are optional!! No connections in the boxes!!!
customer_reviews.author: The Lion

customer_reviews.title: Simplicity Itself, high recommendation
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Battery Tender solar panel with the addition of battery post connections and a 25' extension cord. I've left the solar panel inside my vehicle on the dash. I drive a 1993 Ford Falcon RV and use the tender to maintain my coach battery. The tender works great charging the battery even on low sun days. When parked at a campground I pull it out of the cab and position it for maximum sun. Couldn't be easier. Great product. I've just ordered the USB adapter so that I can charge cell phone and such when the battery doesn't need the extra push.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. We have it on our boat while it ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. We have it on our boat while it site on the slip. AZMrListerdotcom
customer_reviews.author: Ctops

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely LOOOOOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I was about to run an electric line about 75' long when my NEW neighbor asked me what I was doing. I explained to him how I barely drive my F350 and how at my last warehouse I parked the truck close enough to plug the Battery Tender into the outlet right next to the building and now I'm going to have to run a line from the new building to the truck because I can't park right next to the new building. He said, "You ever try a Solar Powered Battery Tender?" And the rest is history!!!!! Absolutely Love This!!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Refund Please!
customer_reviews.text: Used it to keep the battery on my brand new motorcycle charged. Battery had a full change with zero drain and 2 days later - batter was dead. LED blinks away and never turns green. Bought a new battery and had the electrical system checked for faults and it was in perfect working order. After 2 days the new battery was also dead. Refund please!
customer_reviews.author: Juan E Delgado

customer_reviews.title: This is great price for a solar charger
customer_reviews.text: This is great price for a solar charger. Installed on my fathers boat to keep the battery charged so he would not have to remove and place on charger. Keeps it fully charged all season and was easy to install. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: John D. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for dump trailers or winch batteries
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my batteries charged on my Trailers where I park my trailer is the nearest extension cord outlet is roughly half a mile away so solar is a must charge is my dump trailer in about two or three days after several dumps Also keeps the winch battery on my car hauler full. allowing a battery to go dead and spoil cost more than this charger does so it’s a no-brainer
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hook up, and works well.
customer_reviews.text: Installed solar charger in my class c motor home last fall: removed it yesterday, and the rv started right up! We don’t get much sunshine in our area, but the charger worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Martin Kozusnik

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice but is useless. Drains batteries instead of charging them. Moved it to various pieces of construction equipment that are parked outside over a 4 week period and it drained each battery. I was hoping since it was a reputable name brand it would work great. I was wrong. It is junk. I wish I would have returned it earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality.  Easy install on my garage roof.
customer_reviews.text: It is what it claims to be. It does what it claims to do. On top of that, it was super easy to install. I can't ask for more than that. Neither should you. :-P I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Ujvari

customer_reviews.title: Great panel gave it four stars for two reasons
customer_reviews.text: Great panel gave it four stars for two reasons: 1. Corner mounting points are plastic and weak, also I might be wrong on this but I don't think so. The corner mounting holes stick out from the panel frame when It doesn't look like the needed to this just wastes space and doesn't allow for multiple panels to be mounted flush against each other. 2. Charge controller should be at the other end of the cord who wants to crawl on the roof of there shed to check the batteries status. Other than those it's great. :)
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: "MAINTAINER"  not a charger per say.
customer_reviews.text: I felt the ad promoted this as a "charger". I would call this product a "maintainer" at best. It is a very very slow charge, took 2 days to turn the indicator light green when put on a brand new fully charged battery ☹
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Worked for less than a week currently NOT working I am about to request a refund
customer_reviews.author: kevin watts

customer_reviews.title: It senses voltage before it work so if you don't have a great connection to the batteries it won't do anything
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 of these now hooked to the battery bank in my work Van. Many people who say they are having a problem with these dont have a good connection. It senses Vltage before it starts working so if you connection is bad it wont work.
customer_reviews.author: Valued and highly respected

customer_reviews.title: My unit failed after about 45 days. Now I ...
customer_reviews.text: My unit failed after about 45 days. Now I have missed the return window. Apparently will need to work with the manufacturer to remedy. Suggest you look elsewhere for your solar charging needs. Quite a few DOA reviews recently.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bonnet

customer_reviews.title: would buy more
customer_reviews.text: I use it to keep the batter on a snapper charged up. the mover sits for long periods between use at a remote camp. batter stay charged at correct voltage and does not over charge which is important to battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for maintaining batteries in RV
customer_reviews.text: Bought to charge house batteries on my diesel pusher. Works fine, build quality leaves a little to be desired. We haven't had any harsh weather het (thankfully) but I do have concerns about the durability, however, I'll defer until a storm or two comes through. Bought with a 25' extender and mounted just outside covered storage to insure 8 hours of sun hits the panel. Batteries continuously hold a charge without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Klrsmile

customer_reviews.title: No output- dead batteries
customer_reviews.text: I show no output to my batteries. It has a defect. I have a message into tech services to trouble shoot, but they have not returned my message.
customer_reviews.author: GMO Ron

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it, buy something better
customer_reviews.text: Just ok. Will maintain a fully charged batter if given enough sunlight, but don’t expect it to bring voltage up. I can’t recommend for much of anything unless you have consistent sunny during storage
customer_reviews.author: yanez

customer_reviews.title: Solar battery tender.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this panel to keep the engine battery on my motorhome charged while it was stored. I’m on my fourth season now and it still functions as it was intended. I have also used it when we are camping without hookups. It keeps the house battery charged so we have battery power during the night.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Works, but could benefit from design changes...
customer_reviews.text: this product works first and foremost. Second is the limitations in its design to mount the panel. I mounted mine in a window in my garage but the flaw is that you cannot flip the LED display to show status on the battery. One asks themselves, Why not have the status light and controls on the end of the leadwires to allow you to mount the panel anywhere and still see the status light? Something to think about deltran...seriously, think about it for the next gen of solar chargers/maintainers. I would seriously invest in a solar mount on my roof to maintain all of my equipment as long as I can see the status light in a subpanel control.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason for 4 stars and not 5 is that I can't believe that they didn't come with a protective cover for the 2-prong connector. After all, this solar charger is advertised as "waterproof", which tells me it's intended to be used outdoors. I have 2 of them attached to the woodshed that I park the atvs beside during the summer. It'd be nice to be able to protect the connectors when they're not connected to the atv. I also wish that the cable/cord was a bit longer. Eight or 10 feet, instead of 5 feet would have been nice - I wouldn't have had to buy two extensions.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall F. Stratton III

customer_reviews.title: Too weak for a two-battery 12V travel trailer system - get the 10W or 15W unit
customer_reviews.text: It's too weak tor the two-battery 12V system in my travel trailer. All it does is to double the length of the time interval between required 120V-charger battery recharges. Buy the 10W or 15W unit instead. The first one didn't work at all, but was cheerfully and quickly replaced by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: ChuckH

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! We leave the solar panel on the dashboard when we aren’t using the car regularly, and it keeps the battery fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Denise M. Durrett

customer_reviews.title: Use this as long term battery maintenance on my stored vehicles
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this with the 25 foot extension cable and the ring terminals with fuse. I have been using this for quite awhile and could leave the vehicle for a few weeks before I go back to go for a drive. I simply unplug the connection at the battery and start the car. It works as it states, and because I live in Florida, there are no further costs, solar is free.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: STOPPED WORKING after 1 year and a half
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in Dec 2018 and it is now no longer working. Used it for a year and a half to maintain the battery in our spare truck. This should not have stopped working after only that short time of use. I would not recommend this product. It was always kept out of any weather as well. We mounted it on the dash of the truck.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Jo

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 6 months. Zero output when tested with a multimeter.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Solar Battery Tender
customer_reviews.text: I have this on a shed that houses my Harley Davidson. It keeps it charged with one day of placing, and maintains well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extension cords would be long and a nuisance for things like animals and the lawn tractor
customer_reviews.text: Hobbyists, car/truck/mc folks or anyone that has a ride that sits for long periods, this is a go to. My wife bought this for ol' yellar (rock crawler) since he lives further away from the house now. Extension cords would be long and a nuisance for things like animals and the lawn tractor. I haven't started him in what seems like 6-7 months but with this baby on no problems.. Even sitting in the winter weather , through that big storm, kept the battery nice and fresh all with no extra charge $$ wise but the cost to buy..
customer_reviews.author: CARRIE SENINGEN

customer_reviews.title: Does what it supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Work good enough to keep to batteries charged after about a day or two of sun. It’s nice that I don’t have to drag a extension cord out and plug in the trailer every time I put it away. The only reason why I didn’t give it 5 stars is it is kinda fragile. I feel like one good drop and it history
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Battery Tender 12V, 270mA, 5W Solar Battery Charger
product_meta.description: Style:5 Watt Solar PanelThe Battery Tender Solar Tender 12V 5W Battery Charger is a 100 percent portable battery charging and maintenance device. It is perfect for storage space without power access and is the only type of solar panel available with a built-in charge controller to prevent overcharging.
feature_bullets: 5W solar panel with built-in Battery Tender 3-step microcontroller for super-smart charging that ensures that your battery is not damaged by overcharging
Output: 12 VDC, 270 mAmp DC, 5W max for battery charging and maintenance
Worry free: Reverse polarity protection, waterproof, sparkproof, built in temperature compensation sensor, and CE approved
Great for: Outdoor use, trickle charging, off road motorcycle, all-terrain vehicles
Approximate dimensions: 14"W X 16"L X 1"H; Weight: 3 pounds

specifications.Cover Included: Battery Tender Solar Tender 12V 270mA 5W Battery Charger
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,126 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
